page.title: 17AMENITIES IN HEADCORN
page.content: For the elderly in the area there is a {Day Centre}run by volunteers which provides entertainment and a midday meal for its 30 or so members. A sub-branch of the{Kent County Library operates weekly in a room at the Village Hall and has a wide cross section of books.{The Village Hall}is a fairly modern building and here village clubs and societies meet and hold jumble sales. Sometimes a play is performed by the Headcorn Players. There are 4{public houses}in the immediate village and 1 at Hawkenbury The nearest{cinema}is at Maidstone as is the nearest "live"{theatre. Adult {Education Classes}are held at the school in the evenings and they include flower arranging,Yoga and Keep Fit. There is a network of well-marked public{footpaths}around the area and the Footpath Society conducts walks.
